meanings.definition: A condition in which an organism has an abnormal number of chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the aneuploidies in the fruit flies.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that aneuploidies can lead to genetic disorders.
meanings.sent3: The classroom of aneuploidies chromosomes made the biology students chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The field of aneuploidies was like a puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent5: The image of aneuploidies chromosomes stuck in the students' minds.

meanings.definition: The presence of an abnormal number of chromosomes in a cell.
meanings.sent1: The lab technician observed the aneuploidies under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Aneuploidies can affect the cell's ability to divide properly.
meanings.sent3: The party of aneuploidies chromosomes in the cell was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The room full of aneuploidies felt chaotic and out of balance.
meanings.sent5: The sight of aneuploidies chromosomes was like a jumbled mess in the cell.
